body.content:
-- 
Dear Sir,
The aviation industry is facing a challenging time as travelling 
restrictions persist and airplanes are grounded in an effort to stop the 
spread of this infamous coronavirus pandemic. Most airplanes are either 
in short-term park status or are being put in long-term storage. This is 
going to be so for an interminable amount of time, and as such the 
Federal Ministry of Aviation in conjunction with the Nigerian Civil 
Aviation Authority (NCAA) have put in place a preventive measure to keep 
parked airplanes in near ready-to-fly conditions.

This decision has led to some stringent initiatives to properly regulate 
the industry and help ensure the right measures are taken to safely 
return planes to the skies when the time comes and one of these steps is 
to make sure there are availability of spare parts from genuine sources, 
with lubricant oil, and also to emphasize to the individual players in 
the industry the need to abide by the guidelines and instructions 
included in ‘Aircraft OEM’ maintenance manuals.

There is also a high demand for ester-based aviation turbine lubricants, 
due to the increased risk of deterioration of components and structure 
emanating from extended parking periods.

Having said that, I am well connected to key administrative contacts, 
responsible for the award of contracts relating to the supply of oil 
lubricants and other needed aviation supplies on behalf of the agency. 
If you have the capability to source for this product with the prices, I 
will be more than happy to work with you and also link you directly with 
the top government official in charge, so that a quotation can be 
presented in the ongoing tender to supply the products to our 
government.

Best regards,

Kalu Buhari
